Description: In order to prevent use of legacy networks, ECS instances should not have a legacy network configured. Legacy networks have a single network IPv4 prefix range and a single gateway IP address for the whole network. With legacy networks, you cannot create subnetworks or switch from legacy to auto or custom subnet networks.
Risk: Legacy networks can thus have an impact for high network traffic ECS instance and subject to the single point of failure.

Recommendation.Text: Logon to ECS Console. In the left-side navigation pane, choose Instance & Image > Instances. Click Create Instance. Specify the basic instance information required and click Next: Networking. Select the Network Type of VPC.
